title: Apple is walking a perilous tightrope as it tries to keep China onside
text:
Mark Zuckerberg must be relieved. For a brief moment last week, Washington’s enemy number one in Silicon Valley was not Facebook, but a company that has navigated the current political reckoning over tech far more adroitly: Apple.

The iPhone maker has managed to avoid most of the “techlash” of recent years and months. It does not trade in data, making it impervious to any Cambridge Analytica-style privacy outcry. Neither, unlike Facebook, Google or Twitter, does it function as a conduit for information, so it can hardly be accused of spreading fake news.

But Apple does have a political Achilles Heel, and in recent days it has been all too visible. Last week, the company blocked iPhone owners...
